title: What's News: World-Wide
text:
The FDA limited the use of the Covid-19 vaccine from Johnson & Johnson after reviewing the risk of life-threatening blood clots.

The WHO estimated that nearly 15 million people had died from causes related to the coronavirus pandemic by the end of 2021.

The level of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere reached a record high in April, according to measurements at an observatory on Hawaii's Mauna Loa volcano.

Biden named Karine Jean-Pierre to be his new press secretary, elevating Jen Psaki's top deputy.

A suspected terrorist attack in central Israel killed at least three people.

U.S. Indian Health Service hospitals in the Dakotas are facing delays in obtaining lifesaving equipment.

Suspected Colombian drug kingpin Dairo Antonio Ãšsuga was arraigned in a New York federal court.

What's News: World-Wide
